intro: Matelea grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along canyon walls. Matelea grandifolia is a perennial shrub that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
